talk.author: did:plc:jriauiyxnywzcaq3agdg4em6
talk.utter:
Wait are you saying that Bluesky is going to make money by selling my data to companies who want to train AI on it?

That's insane for two reasons:
1. AI companies could get it for free.
2. That's literally the opposite of what the Bluesky people said above, so they'd have to be straight-up lying.

talk.author: did:plc:sfbhltbkoby4ahe4blqktwtz
talk.utter: Yeah, in this case your data is not even a product (at least yet). It’s just being handed over for free. I’m not sure why this makes you feel any better. It will just become a product somewhere downstream

talk.author: did:plc:jriauiyxnywzcaq3agdg4em6
talk.utter: Because my concern is the continued success of this place as a social media platform. I'm resigned to people training AI on things I publish on the internet whether I like it or not.

talk.author: did:plc:jriauiyxnywzcaq3agdg4em6
talk.utter: Because my concern is the continued success of this place as a social media platform. I'm resigned to people training AI on things I publish on the internet whether I like it or not.

talk.author: did:plc:sfbhltbkoby4ahe4blqktwtz
talk.utter: Fair enough. The conversation, started by the original Bluesky post, was specifically about AI though. And their statement aimed towards AI-skeptical artists is very misleading

talk.author: did:plc:jriauiyxnywzcaq3agdg4em6
talk.utter: Oh, I see. Yeah they announced this as "their stance on AI and user data" rather than specifically their own company policies. I see your point.
